marginalia.translation: Flourished under Stephen, king of the English, in the year 1150.

position.marginalia_text: Caradocus Lancarnavensis istius Galfredi conterraneus et synchronus, Reguloru[m] Brytannico[rum] successiones post morte[m] Cadwalladri regis, per 460 ferè annos cum magna diligentia descripsit. Baleus.

marginalia.translation: This Caradocus of Lancashire, fellow countryman and contemporary of Geoffrey of Monmouth, described the successions of British princes after the death of king Cadwaladr of almost 460 years with great diligence. Baloeus.

position.marginalia_text: Nennius Bannochorensis collegij po[n]tifex scripsit de origine Brytanno[rum] de vrbibus Cornub[iae] Cosmographia historia[e] mundi Alterius Nennij chronico[?] in Latinum ver[t???] floruit sub Caduuano Brytanno[rum] Duce a[nn]o à chro[no] incarnato 620

marginalia.translation: Nennius of Bangor, priest of the high college, wrote "De origine Britannorum"; "De urbibus Cornubiae"; and "Cosmographia historiae mundi". [...]. Flourished under Caduanus, leader of the Britons in the year 620.

position.marginalia_text: Samuel Beulanius, scripsit annotatio[n]es in Nenniu[m] Historia[m] et itineraria[m] Arthuri facta apud Scotos floruit sub Cadwallone [deleted Brytannor[um]] Brytanno[rum] duce A[nn]o 640

marginalia.translation: Samuel Beulanius wrote "Annotationes in Nennium"; "Historia itineraria"; and "Arthuri facta apud Scotos". Flourished under Cadwallon, leader of the Britons, in the year 640.
